action.action-desc: Mr. Torres of New York introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the Fair Credit Reporting Act to prohibit the creation and sale of trigger leads, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Trigger Leads Abatement Act of 2022.
Section 604(c) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (15 U.S.C. 1681b(c)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Prohibition on trigger leads for residential mortgage loans
paragraph.text: Notwithstanding paragraph (1), no consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report in connection with a credit transaction that is not initiated by a consumer, if the report is being procured based in whole or in part on the presence of an inquiry made in connection with a residential mortgage loan (as defined under section 103 of the Truth in Lending Act (15 U.S.C. 1602)).
